48 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE int clamp(int value, int lowerLimit, int upperLimit) {
49  assert(lowerLimit <= upperLimit);
50  return std::min(std::max(value, lowerLimit), upperLimit);
51 }
52 
55 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal clamp(decimal value, decimal lowerLimit, decimal upperLimit) {
56  assert(lowerLimit <= upperLimit);
57  return std::min(std::max(value, lowerLimit), upperLimit);
58 }
59 
61 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal min3(decimal a, decimal b, decimal c) {
62  return std::min(std::min(a, b), c);
63 }
64 
66 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal max3(decimal a, decimal b, decimal c) {
67  return std::max(std::max(a, b), c);
68 }
69 
71 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool sameSign(decimal a, decimal b) {
72  return a * b >= decimal(0.0);
73 }

75 // Return true if two vectors are parallel
76 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool areParallelVectors(const Vector3& vector1, const Vector3& vector2) {
77  return vector1.cross(vector2).lengthSquare() < decimal(0.00001);
78 }
79 
80 
81 // Return true if two vectors are orthogonal
82 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool areOrthogonalVectors(const Vector3& vector1, const Vector3& vector2) {
83  return std::abs(vector1.dot(vector2)) < decimal(0.001);
84 }

86 
87 // Clamp a vector such that it is no longer than a given maximum length
88 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector3 clamp(const Vector3& vector, decimal maxLength) {
89  if (vector.lengthSquare() > maxLength * maxLength) {
90  return vector.getUnit() * maxLength;
91  }
92  return vector;
93 }
94 
95 // Compute and return a point on segment from "segPointA" and "segPointB" that is closest to point "pointC"
96 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector3 computeClosestPointOnSegment(const Vector3& segPointA, const Vector3& segPointB, const Vector3& pointC) {
97 
98  const Vector3 ab = segPointB - segPointA;
99 
100  decimal abLengthSquare = ab.lengthSquare();
101 
102  // If the segment has almost zero length
103  if (abLengthSquare < MACHINE_EPSILON) {
104 
105  // Return one end-point of the segment as the closest point
106  return segPointA;
107  }
108 
109  // Project point C onto "AB" line
110  decimal t = (pointC - segPointA).dot(ab) / abLengthSquare;
111 
112  // If projected point onto the line is outside the segment, clamp it to the segment
113  if (t < decimal(0.0)) t = decimal(0.0);
114  if (t > decimal(1.0)) t = decimal(1.0);
115 
116  // Return the closest point on the segment
117  return segPointA + t * ab;
118 }
119 
120 // Compute the closest points between two segments
121 // This method uses the technique described in the book Real-Time
122 // collision detection by Christer Ericson.
123 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void computeClosestPointBetweenTwoSegments(const Vector3& seg1PointA, const Vector3& seg1PointB,
124  const Vector3& seg2PointA, const Vector3& seg2PointB,
125  Vector3& closestPointSeg1, Vector3& closestPointSeg2) {
126 
127  const Vector3 d1 = seg1PointB - seg1PointA;
128  const Vector3 d2 = seg2PointB - seg2PointA;
129  const Vector3 r = seg1PointA - seg2PointA;
130  decimal a = d1.lengthSquare();
131  decimal e = d2.lengthSquare();
132  decimal f = d2.dot(r);
133  decimal s, t;
134 
135  // If both segments degenerate into points
136  if (a <= MACHINE_EPSILON && e <= MACHINE_EPSILON) {
137 
138  closestPointSeg1 = seg1PointA;
139  closestPointSeg2 = seg2PointA;
140  return;
141  }
142  if (a <= MACHINE_EPSILON) { // If first segment degenerates into a point
143 
144  s = decimal(0.0);
145 
146  // Compute the closest point on second segment
147  t = clamp(f / e, decimal(0.0), decimal(1.0));
148  }
149  else {
150 
151  decimal c = d1.dot(r);
152 
153  // If the second segment degenerates into a point
154  if (e <= MACHINE_EPSILON) {
155 
156  t = decimal(0.0);
157  s = clamp(-c / a, decimal(0.0), decimal(1.0));
158  }
159  else {
160 
161  decimal b = d1.dot(d2);
162  decimal denom = a * e - b * b;
163 
164  // If the segments are not parallel
165  if (denom != decimal(0.0)) {
166 
167  // Compute the closest point on line 1 to line 2 and
168  // clamp to first segment.
169  s = clamp((b * f - c * e) / denom, decimal(0.0), decimal(1.0));
170  }
171  else {
172 
173  // Pick an arbitrary point on first segment
174  s = decimal(0.0);
175  }
176 
177  // Compute the point on line 2 closest to the closest point
178  // we have just found
179  t = (b * s + f) / e;
180 
181  // If this closest point is inside second segment (t in [0, 1]), we are done.
182  // Otherwise, we clamp the point to the second segment and compute again the
183  // closest point on segment 1
184  if (t < decimal(0.0)) {
185  t = decimal(0.0);
186  s = clamp(-c / a, decimal(0.0), decimal(1.0));
187  }
188  else if (t > decimal(1.0)) {
189  t = decimal(1.0);
190  s = clamp((b - c) / a, decimal(0.0), decimal(1.0));
191  }
192  }
193  }
194 
195  // Compute the closest points on both segments
196  closestPointSeg1 = seg1PointA + d1 * s;
197  closestPointSeg2 = seg2PointA + d2 * t;
198 }
199 
200 // Compute the barycentric coordinates u, v, w of a point p inside the triangle (a, b, c)
201 // This method uses the technique described in the book Real-Time collision detection by
202 // Christer Ericson.
203 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void computeBarycentricCoordinatesInTriangle(const Vector3& a, const Vector3& b, const Vector3& c,
204  const Vector3& p, decimal& u, decimal& v, decimal& w) {
205  const Vector3 v0 = b - a;
206  const Vector3 v1 = c - a;
207  const Vector3 v2 = p - a;
208 
209  const decimal d00 = v0.dot(v0);
210  const decimal d01 = v0.dot(v1);
211  const decimal d11 = v1.dot(v1);
212  const decimal d20 = v2.dot(v0);
213  const decimal d21 = v2.dot(v1);
214 
215  const decimal denom = d00 * d11 - d01 * d01;
216  v = (d11 * d20 - d01 * d21) / denom;
217  w = (d00 * d21 - d01 * d20) / denom;
218  u = decimal(1.0) - v - w;
219 }
220 
221 // Compute the intersection between a plane and a segment
222 // Let the plane define by the equation planeNormal.dot(X) = planeD with X a point on the plane and "planeNormal" the plane normal. This method
223 // computes the intersection P between the plane and the segment (segA, segB). The method returns the value "t" such
224 // that P = segA + t * (segB - segA). Note that it only returns a value in [0, 1] if there is an intersection. Otherwise,
225 // there is no intersection between the plane and the segment.
226 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal computePlaneSegmentIntersection(const Vector3& segA, const Vector3& segB, const decimal planeD, const Vector3& planeNormal) {
227 
228  const decimal parallelEpsilon = decimal(0.0001);
229  decimal t = decimal(-1);
230 
231  const decimal nDotAB = planeNormal.dot(segB - segA);
232 
233  // If the segment is not parallel to the plane
234  if (std::abs(nDotAB) > parallelEpsilon) {
235  t = (planeD - planeNormal.dot(segA)) / nDotAB;
236  }
237 
238  return t;
239 }
240 
241 // Compute the distance between a point "point" and a line given by the points "linePointA" and "linePointB"
242 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal computePointToLineDistance(const Vector3& linePointA, const Vector3& linePointB, const Vector3& point) {
243 
244  decimal distAB = (linePointB - linePointA).length();
245 
246  if (distAB < MACHINE_EPSILON) {
247  return (point - linePointA).length();
248  }
249 
250  return ((point - linePointA).cross(point - linePointB)).length() / distAB;
251 }
252 
253 
254 // Clip a segment against multiple planes and return the clipped segment vertices
255 // This method implements the Sutherlandâ€“Hodgman clipping algorithm
256 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Array<Vector3> clipSegmentWithPlanes(const Vector3& segA, const Vector3& segB,
257  const Array<Vector3>& planesPoints,
258  const Array<Vector3>& planesNormals,
259  MemoryAllocator& allocator) {
260  assert(planesPoints.size() == planesNormals.size());
261 
262  Array<Vector3> inputVertices(allocator, 2);
263  Array<Vector3> outputVertices(allocator, 2);
264 
265  inputVertices.add(segA);
266  inputVertices.add(segB);
267 
268  // For each clipping plane
269  const uint32 nbPlanesPoints = static_cast<uint32>(planesPoints.size());
270  for (uint32 p=0; p < nbPlanesPoints; p++) {
271 
272  // If there is no more vertices, stop
273  if (inputVertices.size() == 0) return inputVertices;
274 
275  assert(inputVertices.size() == 2);
276 
277  outputVertices.clear();
278 
279  Vector3& v1 = inputVertices[0];
280  Vector3& v2 = inputVertices[1];
281 
282  decimal v1DotN = (v1 - planesPoints[p]).dot(planesNormals[p]);
283  decimal v2DotN = (v2 - planesPoints[p]).dot(planesNormals[p]);
284 
285  // If the second vertex is in front of the clippling plane
286  if (v2DotN >= decimal(0.0)) {
287 
288  // If the first vertex is not in front of the clippling plane
289  if (v1DotN < decimal(0.0)) {
290 
291  // The second point we keep is the intersection between the segment v1, v2 and the clipping plane
292  decimal t = computePlaneSegmentIntersection(v1, v2, planesNormals[p].dot(planesPoints[p]), planesNormals[p]);
293 
294  if (t >= decimal(0) && t <= decimal(1.0)) {
295  outputVertices.add(v1 + t * (v2 - v1));
296  }
297  else {
298  outputVertices.add(v2);
299  }
300  }
301  else {
302  outputVertices.add(v1);
303  }
304 
305  // Add the second vertex
306  outputVertices.add(v2);
307  }
308  else { // If the second vertex is behind the clipping plane
309 
310  // If the first vertex is in front of the clippling plane
311  if (v1DotN >= decimal(0.0)) {
312 
313  outputVertices.add(v1);
314 
315  // The first point we keep is the intersection between the segment v1, v2 and the clipping plane
316  decimal t = computePlaneSegmentIntersection(v1, v2, -planesNormals[p].dot(planesPoints[p]), -planesNormals[p]);
317 
318  if (t >= decimal(0.0) && t <= decimal(1.0)) {
319  outputVertices.add(v1 + t * (v2 - v1));
320  }
321  }
322  }
323 
324  inputVertices = outputVertices;
325  }
326 
327  return outputVertices;
328 }
329 
330 // Clip a polygon against a single plane and return the clipped polygon vertices
331 // This method implements the Sutherlandâ€“Hodgman polygon clipping algorithm
332 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE void clipPolygonWithPlane(const Array<Vector3>& polygonVertices, const Vector3& planePoint,
333  const Vector3& planeNormal, Array<Vector3>& outClippedPolygonVertices) {
334 
335  uint32 nbInputVertices = static_cast<uint32>(polygonVertices.size());
336 
337  assert(outClippedPolygonVertices.size() == 0);
338 
339  uint32 vStartIndex = nbInputVertices - 1;
340 
341  const decimal planeNormalDotPlanePoint = planeNormal.dot(planePoint);
342 
343  decimal vStartDotN = (polygonVertices[vStartIndex] - planePoint).dot(planeNormal);
344 
345  // For each edge of the polygon
346  for (uint vEndIndex = 0; vEndIndex < nbInputVertices; vEndIndex++) {
347 
348  const Vector3& vStart = polygonVertices[vStartIndex];
349  const Vector3& vEnd = polygonVertices[vEndIndex];
350 
351  const decimal vEndDotN = (vEnd - planePoint).dot(planeNormal);
352 
353  // If the second vertex is in front of the clippling plane
354  if (vEndDotN >= decimal(0.0)) {
355 
356  // If the first vertex is not in front of the clippling plane
357  if (vStartDotN < decimal(0.0)) {
358 
359  // The second point we keep is the intersection between the segment v1, v2 and the clipping plane
360  const decimal t = computePlaneSegmentIntersection(vStart, vEnd, planeNormalDotPlanePoint, planeNormal);
361 
362  if (t >= decimal(0) && t <= decimal(1.0)) {
363  outClippedPolygonVertices.add(vStart + t * (vEnd - vStart));
364  }
365  else {
366  outClippedPolygonVertices.add(vEnd);
367  }
368  }
369 
370  // Add the second vertex
371  outClippedPolygonVertices.add(vEnd);
372  }
373  else { // If the second vertex is behind the clipping plane
374 
375  // If the first vertex is in front of the clippling plane
376  if (vStartDotN >= decimal(0.0)) {
377 
378  // The first point we keep is the intersection between the segment v1, v2 and the clipping plane
379  const decimal t = computePlaneSegmentIntersection(vStart, vEnd, -planeNormalDotPlanePoint, -planeNormal);
380 
381  if (t >= decimal(0.0) && t <= decimal(1.0)) {
382  outClippedPolygonVertices.add(vStart + t * (vEnd - vStart));
383  }
384  else {
385  outClippedPolygonVertices.add(vStart);
386  }
387  }
388  }
389 
390  vStartIndex = vEndIndex;
391  vStartDotN = vEndDotN;
392  }
393 }
394 
395 // Project a point onto a plane that is given by a point and its unit length normal
396 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE Vector3 projectPointOntoPlane(const Vector3& point, const Vector3& unitPlaneNormal, const Vector3& planePoint) {
397  return point - unitPlaneNormal.dot(point - planePoint) * unitPlaneNormal;
398 }
399 
400 // Return the distance between a point and a plane (the plane normal must be normalized)
401 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE decimal computePointToPlaneDistance(const Vector3& point, const Vector3& planeNormal, const Vector3& planePoint) {
402  return planeNormal.dot(point - planePoint);
403 }
404 
406 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE bool isPowerOfTwo(uint64 number) {
407  return number != 0 && !(number & (number -1));
408 }
409 
411 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE uint64 nextPowerOfTwo64Bits(uint64 number) {
412  number--;
413  number |= number >> 1;
414  number |= number >> 2;
415  number |= number >> 4;
416  number |= number >> 8;
417  number |= number >> 16;
418  number |= number >> 32;
419  number++;
420  number += (number == 0);
421  return number;
422 }
423 
428 RP3D_FORCE_INLINE uint64 pairNumbers(uint32 number1, uint32 number2) {
429  assert(number1 == std::max(number1, number2));
430  uint64 nb1 = number1;
431  uint64 nb2 = number2;
432  return nb1 * nb1 + nb1 + nb2;
433 }
434 
435 
436 }
